main event: A sighting of cylindrical, bright, disc-shaped objects that emitted a light glow and vanished suddenly was reported near Duluth, Minnesota on July 17, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were observed for a few minutes and appeared to be dull circular shaped objects, about two feet in diameter, emitting a light glow.
The lead object appeared closer than the trailing objects, and all objects vanished suddenly without leaving a trail or sound.
The observer, identified as a private investigator and insurance adjuster, reported the objects moving in formation and estimated their height from the ground.
The report includes detailed questionnaires, sketches, and specific observations about the weather conditions and the appearance of the objects.
The sighting was part of a series of UFO sightings in July 1952, with other reports from various locations, including military observations.
sighted object: Cylindrical, bright, disc-shaped objects emitting a light glow
